title.narrative: Action plan Ankole 2011: expanding into washed arabica

description.narrative:
Ankole Coffee Producer Cooperative Union Ltd (ACPCU) has a membership of 13 primary cooperative societies with a total of 5788 members. The union is specialized in the commercialization and marketing of coffee, 90% Robusta and 10% Arabica. In May 2010 the board and management agreed that the organization should expand the membership and its washed Arabica production.
Agriterra – in person of Mascha Middelbeek and Athanasio Massenha - visited ACPCU on 17th March, 2011 in Ishaka – Bushenyi for the purpose of pre-assessing the organization and business potential. During the visit ACPCU presented the business idea of going into Fairtrade Organic Fully Washed Coffee. A concept note for the business idea was shared to Agriterra and the contents and organizational potential provided Agriterra with sufficient reasons to organise a company assessment to ACPCU in April 2011.
In April 2011 the company assessment was executed and ACPCU's performace and business idea were both assessed positively. Jointly with board and management the follwoing action plan was developed in order to come to a bancable business plan.
Recruit 5 Mild Arabica Primary Societies 1.1 Sensitization visits 1.2 Registration of 5 new PCS 1.3 Admission of 5 new PCSs to ACPCU
Capacity building of Boards, Management & farmers 2.1 Board training 2.2 Manager, Chair & Treasurer training 2.3 Farmer training 2.4 Exchange visits for 5 PCS
Undertaking a feasibility study and full business plan for fully washed Fairtrade Organic coffee 3.1 Survey coffee availability and expected production volumes 3.2 Develop ToR for business planning 3.3 Recruit consultant 3.4 Feasibility study and business plan finalized 3.5 Three new clients mobilized 3.6 Increase in sales and turn over
Implement business plan 4.1 Mobilize finance for business plan 4.2 Implement business plan.
Produire des quantités importantes pour pouvoir répondre efficacement au besoin de marché et obtenir de ce dernier un prix rémunérateur en vue d'augmenter le revenu des ménages. Promouvoir l'esprit entrepreneurial dans les coopératives agricoles membres de l'UPDI à travers les activités génératrices. Valoriser la participation économique de la femme au sein des coopératives membres de l'Union pour la promotion du genre et l'accroissement de revenu au sein des ménages.
